meanings.definition: To resolve or reach an agreement
meanings.sent1: After much discussion, they finally settle on a movie to watch.
meanings.sent2: The two friends settle their argument by talking it out.
meanings.sent3: The negotiation to settle on a pizza topping was intense.
meanings.sent4: Let's settle this like adults and find a compromise.
meanings.sent5: The mediator helped them settle their differences peacefully.

meanings.sent1: They decide to settle in a cozy little house by the lake.
meanings.sent2: The family plans to settle down in the new town next month.
meanings.sent3: The birds settle in the trees as the sun sets.
meanings.sent4: The nomadic tribe finally settles in a fertile valley.
meanings.sent5: They dream of settling in a quaint village far from the city.

meanings.definition: To sink or come to rest
meanings.sent1: The dust particles settle on the surface of the table.
meanings.sent2: The snowflakes settle gently on the ground during winter.
meanings.sent3: The leaves settle at the bottom of the pond after falling.
meanings.sent4: The sediment will settle at the bottom of the jar over time.
meanings.sent5: The sand settles at the bottom of the hourglass as time passes.

meanings.sent1: He works hard to settle his credit card debt.
meanings.sent2: She plans to settle the loan with her next paycheck.
meanings.sent3: The company aims to settle all outstanding debts by the end of the year.
meanings.sent4: They finally settle the debt with a lump sum payment.
meanings.sent5: It feels good to settle a debt and be financially free.

meanings.definition: A long wooden bench with a high back
meanings.sent1: The old tavern had a sturdy settle by the fireplace.
meanings.sent2: The settle in the park provided a comfortable spot to rest.
meanings.sent3: The settle in the waiting room was perfect for tired travelers.
meanings.sent4: The settle in the library was a favorite reading spot for many.
meanings.sent5: The settle in the garden was a peaceful place to relax.
